acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=4microg/L of Crustacea (Amphipod) (HSDB, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 1 based on rat LD50= 3.8mg/kg calculated from eight data (ACGIH (2005), PDs No.75 (1988)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: The saturated vapor pressures concentrations pressure of this product is 1.0ppm (0.011mg/L). The lower value of the data of both sexes in rat 1 examination (ACGIH (2005)), this is indicated to have done in mist, was adopted. And it was set as Category 1 based on LC50 = 0.0028mg/L..

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set as Category 1 based on rat LD50= 1.5mg/kg calculated from eight data (ACGIH (2005), PDs No.75 (1988)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on what is classified into A4 according to ACGIH (ACGIH (2005)), it carried out the outside of Category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), though supposed less bioaccumulative (log Kow=3.56(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Since its flash point being 110 degC or more (Closed Cup) and 160 degC (Open Cup), which are beyond Category 4 (standard: flash point being more than 60 degC and 93 degC or less) of GHS, it was classified as out of Category.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the negative results (ACGIH (2005), JMPR 416 (1977)) for the in vivo dominant lethality examination using the mouse, and the chromosomal aberration test using rat marrow cells. We classified it as Out Of Category according to the technical guideline.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing oxygen bonded to phosphorus.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Since flash measurements was performed at 160 degC (ICSC (2000)) and it judged that there was no spontaneous combustibility in normal temperatures, it carried out the outside of Category.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into category 2 based on the statement that effects as decrease neonatal lethality and heart hypertrophy are observed at dose causing toxicity to parents or not indicating about parent toxicity (ACGIH (2005), JMPR 416 (1977)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though the substance contains P-O bonds as chemical groups with self-reactive properties present.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the statement that cholinergic neurotoxicity was affected in the animal with the given dose of the guidance value range of Category 1 (ACGIH and (2005), JMPR 882 (1994)) and that cholinesterase neurologic typical symptoms  are observed in  human(ACGIH (2005)), it was classified into Category 1 (nerve systems).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: A statement that cholinergic neurotoxicity is discovered in a rat with the dosage of guidance value within the Category 1 (ACGIH (2005)). And based on the statement that cholinergic neurotoxicity is seen by humans (ACGIH (2005), ICSC (J) (2000)), it is classified into Category 1 (nerve systems).
